title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Physicists and Astronomers

content.rendered:
What are Physicists and Astronomers?

Physicists and Astronomers observe, research, and theorize in order to better understand the universe and all of its parts.

Where do Physicists and Astronomers work?

  • Laboratories
  • Observatories
  • Offices

How much do Physicists and Astronomers make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Physicists and Astronomers is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Physicists and Astronomers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Physics majors
  • Astronomy majors
  • Biology majors
Search jobs on Handshake

Physicist and Astronomer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Physicists and Astronomers succeed in their work:

  • Analytical skills
  • Math skills
  • Problem solving skills

What are some common questions about Physicists and Astronomers?

Q: What do Physicists and Astronomers do?

A: They plan and execute scientific experiments to both test and discover new properties of nature. They study the ways that matter and energy interact.
